reviews.review_msg: I encourage people to take Dr. Rahman's class; his lectures are like "edutainment" and he's just generally a pleasant person to be in the same room with. HW is light. He's also a very snappy dresser, so you're not giving him a makeover in your mind while he's trying to lecture (not sure if I'm the only one who gets distracted by that thought).

Anis is an awesome guy! very helpful and always encourages questions. His accent is strong and sometimes tough to understand but you will get the concept. Interesting lectures, and he's  got a good sense of humour!
Anis was very funny and was engaged with the course material. The down side was he has a thick accent therefore it was hard to understand what he was saying most of the time.

Scott's lectures could be interesting at times but his vocabulary is way beyond his students (espicially for a first-level class). He tended to lecture on things beyond the scope of the course in order to truly make it a full overview of cmns. 3 Papers at 30% each and 10% for participation makes for an easy class if you can write.
A really good lecturer he is funny and enthusiastic - would 100% recommend! The content was fairly easy just a paper and 2 exams
Took back on 09, very interesting. Great lectures.

This is one of the most boring classes I have ever taken at SFU. CMNS 110 requires a lot of reading, and the reading is super long and dry. His lectures are not always related to the readings too, so it can get a little confusing. He is a very nice guy though, and tells some pretty interesting stories.
Great, clear, helpful and funny, not boring at all.
makes concepts very clear and uses funny stories to make his points!
one of the best profs I ever had....thank you.
